data.title: National Benzole 1933
data.meta_description: National Benzole mixture 1933. 'British colliers appeal to British motorists'. An appeal to the British public to be patriotic by buying Benzole made from coal rather than...
data.text:
Choose from the extensive historic photographic archive of the British Motor Industry Heritage Trust (BMIHT), a priceless resource spanning over a 100 years of the motor industry and motor sport including racing, rallying, advertising, manufacturing and social history.

How are the photos printed?

Produced using professional photographic C-type printers, on 250 gsm Professional Fuji Crystal Archive Matt paper with a lifespan of 80+ years. Each image is checked before processing to ensure the maximum print quality.

Do you crop the photos?

Most images have been sized to fit our standard prints sizes and are printed full size bleed to the edge of the paper. Some photos may require minor cropping and therefore could slightly differ to what you see on the site, however if we feel cropping would compromise the photo we will reduce the image size to fit within the standard print size.

Print sizes and costs

12x8", 305x203mm,

Initial = £13.95

Copies = £12.95

16x11", 406x280mm,

Initial = £18.95

Copies = £17.98

22x15", 558x381mm,

Initial = £24.95

Copies = £23.75

30x20", 762x508mm,

Initial = £36.95

Copies = £35.45

Please note all sizes are within 2mm. All prices include VAT

How are the Canvases Printed?

Using the latest printing technology featuring a 12 colour printing process producing exceptional, vibrant results, our canvases are printed using pigment inks on a high quality UK manufactured 360 gsm poly-cotton canvas.

We use a very smooth surface canvas in order to maintain as much image detail as possible. To ensure the ultimate protection and long life of the canvases all canvases are sealed using our Heatseal Lamination process. This provides protection against fading from UV light together with a scratch proof, water resistant surface, without losing the canvas look.

How are they Framed?

After sealing which ensure the edges of the canvas will not crack when stretched around the stretcher bar. They are hand finished by stretching the canvas over a 32 mm stretcher bar under high tension.

The edges/sides of the canvas between the image and the back of the frame, is white. White edge canvases are standard, while full bleed canvases are subject to a 10% charge depending on the size of the order. Contact us offline for more details and pricing.

How long will a canvas take to complete?

Orders will be despatched within 6 working days.

Print sizes and costs

15x10", 381x254mm

= £54.95

24x16", 610x406mm

= £94.95

36x24", 915x610mm

= £135.95

42x28", 1067x711mm

= £155.95

Please note all sizes are within 4mm. All prices include VAT
